definition[0]: a unit for measuring computer information, equal to eight bits (=the smallest unit on which information is stored on a computer)
example[0]: Each character requires one byte of storage space.
definition[1]: a unit of computer information that can hold one number or letter. A byte is made up of eight BITs (=the smallest units of storage on a computer). The amount of processing space on a computer is measured in MEGABYTEs (=a million bytes), so for example a PC with 32 megabytes of space has space for 32 million bytes of information
